title: Why isnt Mordekaiser metal anymore?
body: None of his abilities are named after famous metal songs anymore, which was kind of his whole thing before.  Is there a reason to gut the small flavor text things people enjoy about champs when reworking them?  does this design team not understand the references the champion was built on?  Is it necessary to remove a champions soul and flavor when rebuilding there kit?  He looks great, but to me its a bizzare misstep to pull one of his key features

replies.body:
- Passive - Darkness Rise = [Immortal - The Rise of Darkness](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8IPeQ-yI0_s)

 
 - Q - Obliterate = [Obliterate - I, Cerberus](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7t_pj3ffB5Q) or just the band in general
 
 
 - W - Indestructible = [Disturbed - Indestructible](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hj2vU2nr5Jw)
 
 
 - E - Death’s Grasp = Most likely a reference to [Pentakill's Deathfire Grasp](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=be1waE9myCU)
 
 
 - R - Realm of Death = [Judas Priest - Beyond the Realms of Death](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ewrSgDf50I)
 
 

 All of his abilities are still named after metal/death metal songs and bands.

FAMOUS HEAVY METAL SONGS.  

you're reaching. it looks like you just google searched each ability to try and find something that fit, but that wasn't the point.  Old Mord was based on the character Iron Man from the Black Sabbath song, in both his look and kit, and all his abilities were named after songs from the genre. His whole creation was a love-letter to heavy metal and it was awesome. I scrolled over Mords bio and instantly got it, as did tens of thousands of others. the new ability names are not only not famous heavy metal songs, they are just random words that sound cool, same as every other champion. they have nothing to do with referencing metal.  to wit:

1) There could be dozens of bands/songs called obliterate, but as a lifelong metal head with decades of interest in the genre I can comfortably say the word is more likely to make me think of Starcraft Archons than Metal.  it just isn't an in-joke to the metal scene.  Even a google search only pulls up a Ukranian band that none of the metal-heads in my scene had heard of. 

2) Disturbed is not a Heavy Metal band. they are radio friendly nu-metal/emo band, which is not only a different genre entirely but is generally disliked by metal heads.  not a heavy metal reference

3) Pentakill is not a Heavy Metal band, they are an in game power metal band. Power metal is basically orchestral Heavy metal, so it sort of works?  Still not a heavy metal in joke

4) I have a Judas Priest tatoo and it didn't even occur to me to put this together.  Maybe that's on me, but I'm pretty sure the dev team named his R without knowing it was similar.

I mean 4 of Garens abilities are Hardcore bands, but that wasnt intentional.  Although Garen is sort of a straight edge avatar

ok but youre saying they arnt named after famous songs in this post in which they are

Record labels that own the rights to certain songs have long since begun a lawsuit campaign against the entertainment industry for so much as using song titles as references.

Jojo's Bizarre Adventure, for instance, was heavily edited in the English dub and all the stands that were named after famous songs were renamed just to avoid legal battles.
